domain_guidance:
When evaluating social skills, pay special attention to:
- The child's interest in and engagement with others
- Whether interactions are initiated by the child or others
- The quality and reciprocity of social exchanges
- The range of social partners (parents, siblings, peers, etc.)
- The presence of joint attention and social referencing
- Any unusual social behaviors or preferences for solitary activities

category_descriptions.cannot_do_desc: Child shows no evidence of the social skill or avoids social interactions
category_descriptions.with_support_desc: Child engages socially with significant prompting or only in highly structured situations
category_descriptions.emerging_desc: Child is beginning to show the social skill but is inconsistent or limited in scope
category_descriptions.independent_desc: Child demonstrates the social skill consistently across different partners and contexts
category_descriptions.lost_skill_desc: Child previously demonstrated the social skill but has regressed or lost the ability
